item.title: Street Cleansing Request, 23rd July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Black Horse Road, Longlands, London

item.title: Nesbit house hackney Reported via mobile in the Drug Paraphernalia / Needles category anonymously at 14:55, Saturday 29 March 2025 Sent to Hackney Council less than a minute later. FixMyStreet ref: 7357005. Caretakers smokeing weede and doing nothing in my block the managers don't care . My block is a mess the caretakers are laughing saying I do what I want, 23rd July
item.description:
Update Hackney Council allow employees to behave like this and smoke drugs on the job because they are incompetent across the whole borough of Hackney. They do not address any issues of anti-social behaviour. Hackney Council only pick on vulnerable people.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Homerton High Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leak into property suspected blocked drains, 23rd July
item.description:
Hi there we have some damage/dampness to a wall at Queensland House 392 Strand and we had a fabric contractor attend and they suggest the issue is from pavement, drain etc outside the property as is coming from ground up in the basement, please can this be looked into urgently
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Adelaide Street, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 metre pothole, 23rd July
item.description:
These potholes on Mayplace Rd, East, are at least 2 metres in length and the depth at least 4 inches deep. Due to the damage of these potholes debris is scattered all over the road and pedestrian footpath. Potential accident waiting to happen. I believe these potholes must meet the council threshold due to the scale, and need repairing immediately.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayplace Road East, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Request for Graffiti Removal – Woodsford Building, 23rd July
item.description:
Subject: Request for Graffiti Removal – Woodsford Building Dear Building Management, I hope this message finds you well. Could you please arrange for someone to clean the graffiti on the walls inside the lounge area near the entrance door of the Woodsford Building on Portland Street, London? Thank you for your assistance

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Portland Street, Walworth, London
